conclusion: Identify the objects and their properties: blocks C, D, E, and F are solid and rigid; objects A and B are flexible materials.
Understand the action described: Objects A and B are moved and placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F, indicating vertical movement and landing.
Identify the force mentioned: Gravity pulls objects downwards.
Interpret 'come into contact with objects C, D, E, F due to gravity': A and B will rest upon or drape over these blocks.
Predict the interaction of flexible objects with rigid objects under gravity: Flexible material will conform to the shape of the solid objects and drape around them.
Synthesize the outcome: A will drape over C and D, and B will drape over E and F due to gravity.
